---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Happy to add some examples if necessary (i.e. replicate `Instances/Real.lean` and `Instances/Sphere.lean` in the analytic setting).

:v: michaellee94 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Thanks very much. I promise future reviews will be quicker!

bors d+

This looks _great_!

I have a few minor remarks and a question for Zulip.

Thanks very much. I promise future reviews will be quicker!

bors d+

I suspect that in applications, `s` will usually be open. With that in mind, how about renaming this to `AnalyticOn.congr'` and adding the following below:
```lean

theorem AnalyticOn.congr {s : Set E} (hs : IsOpen s)
    (hf : AnalyticOn 𝕜 f s) (hg : ∀ z ∈ s, f z = g z) :
    AnalyticOn 𝕜 g s :=
  hf.congr' (fun _ hz ↦ eventuallyEq_iff_exists_mem.mpr ⟨s, hs.mem_nhds hz, hg⟩)
```
Done! Simplified existing proofs using `AnalyticOn.congr` as well.

There is also `PartialOrder` instance defined below and this should satisfy:
```lean
example {G G' : StructureGroupoid H} : G' ∩ G = G ↔ G ≤ G' := sorry
```
In fact I expect there is a `CompleteLattice` structure on `StructureGroupoid H`.

Assuming that's right, it would be nice (but not required) to construct it as part of this work.
Might it be better to use `Inf` here, if a lattice structure is in the future?
@ocfnash I agree, there is a `CompleteLattice` structure on `StructureGroupoid H`. We're missing a few results necessary to show this. I'll work on it and see if I can get it in this PR.
@ocfnash Done!

This is a [non-terminal simp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/extras/simp.html#non-terminal-simps) and should either be squeezed (using `simp?`) into a `simp only [...]` or captured using `suffices`.
Fixed!

This is quite a complicated definition; it looks right to me, but I think I'll invite further comment on Zulip.

The following is true, right:
```lean
theorem mem_analyticGroupoid_of_boundaryless [CompleteSpace 𝕜] [I.Boundaryless]
    (e : LocalHomeomorph H H) :
    e ∈ analyticGroupoid I ↔ AnalyticOn 𝕜 (I ∘ e ∘ I.symm) (I '' e.source) := by
  sorry
```
Assuming I've got that right, it would increase my confidence in the definition if we added this.
Asked [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.236386.20Analytic.20structure.20groupoid/near/383236508) on Zulip.
Will fill in the proof of `mem_analyticGroupoid_of_boundaryless`!
@ocfnash Sorry it took a while to follow up on this! Proof should be added now.
I think we should have an `iff` version of this too.
Done! For `AnalyticOn.congr` as well.

Untested:
```suggestion
    (hg : s.eqOn f g) : AnalyticOn 𝕜 g s :=
```
Done!

Is the following weaker or stronger?
```suggestion
theorem AnalyticOn.congr' {s : Set E} (hf : AnalyticOn 𝕜 f s) (hg : f =ᶠ[𝓝ˢ s] g) :
```

They're equivalent, I believe, by `mem_nhdsSet_iff_forall`.

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/2e06bd9f0f56ec7f72fad9f6bc0acd8ccdc0bf13/Mathlib/Topology/NhdsSet.lean#L47

This compiles:

```
theorem blah {s : Set E} : f =ᶠ[𝓝ˢ s] g ↔ (∀ z ∈ s, f =ᶠ[𝓝 z] g) := mem_nhdsSet_iff_forall
```
In that case, I suspect the spelling I suggested is preferable?
I agree! Just pushed the change.
Can you add the `iff` version of this one?
Done!

```suggestion
variable {𝕜 : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E]
```
and throughout
Done!

For consistency with `ContDiffOn.comp`, `DifferentiableOn.comp`, `ContinuousOn.comp` I think we should swap the names `comp` and `comp'` here.

For the same reason I suggest spelling the hypothesis `st` as `st : Set.MapsTo f s t`.
No worries, thanks for taking another look! Added your suggestions.
